metadata.title: NATO ASI on multifunctional mesoporous inorganic solids

NATOASIMULTIFUNCTIONALMESOPOROUSINORGANICSOLIDS SEQUEIRA SEQUEIRAX1991X282 item 0304-5102(91)80153-T 030451029180153T 1-s2.0-030451029180153T 10.1016/0304-5102(91)80153-T 272239 2024-01-02T01:05:30.650091Z 1991-10-15 1-s2.0-030451029180153T-main.pdf https://s3.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-us-east/content/pii:030451029180153T/MAIN/application/pdf/bc76765dfd7b5ff1b92400c22570b714/main.pdf https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-eu-west/content/pii:030451029180153T/MAIN/application/pdf/bc76765dfd7b5ff1b92400c22570b714/main.pdf main.pdf pdf true 54228 MAIN 1 1-s2.0-030451029180153T-main_1.png https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-eu-west/content/pii:030451029180153T/PREVIEW/image/png/da46bf5c7516fbdd3306749d25e9c882/main_1.png https://s3.amazonaws.com/prod-ucs-content-store-us-east/content/pii:030451029180153T/PREVIEW/image/png/da46bf5c7516fbdd3306749d25e9c882/main_1.png main_1.png png 38759 849 656 IMAGE-WEB-PDF 1 282 Journal of Molecular Catalysis, 69 (1991) 282 Forthcoming Meeting NATO ASI on Multifunctional Mesoporous Inorganic Solids 5-17 April 1992, Hotel Tivoli Sintra, Sintra (Portugal) Mesoporous materials have pore diameters which are within the range of 20 A to 150 A. There is an urgent need to understand the fundamental aspects regarding the synthesis, characterisation and application of such materials which may be used for separation processes with or without membranes, catalysis, non-linear optics, corrosion-resistant coatings, sensors and battery electrodes and electrolytes. Three types of inorganic materials will be discussed: (1) Mesoporous materials from layered compounds such as phosphates, phosphonates, layered double hydroxides and clays. (2) Sol-gel-derived mesoporous oxides such as zirconia and titania. (3) Hydrothermally derived mesoporous zeolites. It is believed that there is a common theme amongst these three classes in that the requirements of pore size, methods of characterisation and applications are similar. Consequently, the ASI will allow experts from the various fields to explore the fundamental aspects. Potential participants are invited to apply as early as possible to: Prof. Cesar A. C. Sequeira Instituto Superior Tecnico Av.
